website_summaries.verdict: Fits perfectly, without any trimming or pushing. But it lacks the baking soda odor-reducing factor of the other choices.
pros: Has an arrow pointing in air flow direction to ensure you don't install it backwards
Mixed-media, multi-layer construction captures more particles while increasing air flow for higher efficiency.GM-recommended replacement part
cons: No baking soda filtration, unlike other brands

customer_reviews.title: First timers Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Slide a thick piece of paper, manilla folder underneath the old filter BEFORE you remove it. Leaves and debris will fall directly into fan if you don't do this.
customer_reviews.author: mudhound0530

customer_reviews.title: Fit my 2016 Yukon perfect
customer_reviews.text: This fit my 2016 Yukon perfectly. A word of caution for a diy filter change, when you remove the old make sure you don’t lose any leaves from the top of the old filter in to the fan. I saw one drop and thought oh well. Well my fan made a super annoying sound for a day from the leaf. I re opened it but could not vacuum the leaf out or grab it with my hands. I gave the 13 year old neighbor ten bucks to put his smaller hand in there (with his dads approval) to get the leaf and make sure there were no others. He got it and all is now well.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Good Replacement
customer_reviews.text: This was a perfect replacement for my 2014 Silverado 1500 cabin filter. Thanks to some who recommended sliding thin cardboard under the filter before pulling the old one out to stop debris dropping into the blower motor. With the cardboard in place slide out the old one then vacuum the cavity and then slide the new one in. Easy. There's Youtube videos if you need to watch how to take out the glove box panel.
customer_reviews.author: A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Fit my 2014 Sierra SLE Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Easy removal and installation of the cabin air filter. Haven't changed mine in about 3-4 years. What a mistake. When I pulled out the old filter the dust, bugs and twigs were every where. This AC Delco CF188 was a direct replacement fit for the filter in my 2014 Sierra SLE Regular cab. Does what it's suppose to do. Thought about sprinkling baking soda on the air inlet side of the filter. Maybe next time. Came wrapped in a plastic bag without a box, so some of the pleats were flattened but not enough to return the filter. Good Buy as I could not find locally without special ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Orange408

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy replacement so save some $$ and don't go ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 2015 Tahoe perfectly. Easy peasy replacement so save some $$ and don't go to the dealer unless you loathe doing your own maintenance. And to call this maintenance is a stretch. I'll rephrase that by saying if you absolutely hate "doing" things and prefer paying someone to accomplish all of your tasks then just go to the dealer and pay him significantly more $$ to change this out for you. But I digress. Fast and secure shipping and a pleasant experience overall.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: AC DELCO OEM Cabin Filter 2019 Yukon XL
customer_reviews.text: Just Replaced Original Cabin Filter on 2019 GMC YUKON XL Fairly easy to replace -Drop glove box by popping cable - right side of box then squeezed the box corners to drop down removed 6 security screws removed the plastic filter cover box removed and replaced old dirty filter. The small torx security screws was a bit of surprise but easy to remove and replace old filter. Our old filter was pretty dirty less than a year of use by us but previous owner may not have changed filter? Proper fit and Great price a plus with rebate !
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Exact replacement for '18 Sierra (most likely all 14-18's)
customer_reviews.text: Exact factory cabin air filter for my '18 Sierra (most likely for all 14-18). As I have seen mentioned elsewhere, be sure to trace out a piece of cardboard the size of the filter and cut out. Place cut out cardboard under old filter before removing (it catches a ton of debris that would otherwise end up in your blower). After you pull old filter out brush off the cardboard and remove old filter then your ready to install fresh filter. This is a PITA process just take your time, a harness wire goes across the front panel of filter cover and doesn't have much wiggle room.
customer_reviews.author: BRAD

customer_reviews.title: OEM All the Way for 2017 Silverado 1500
customer_reviews.text: I just installed this in my 2017 Chevy Silverado 1500, with the 6.2 liter engine. it is OEM all the way with the part number stenciled on it. I ordered two and they arrived well boxed and in their original plastic packaging. What is not to like about this. Always order two and then you will always have a spare. Using a #15 torx screwdriver, to remove the 4 screws, it was a 5 minute job.
customer_reviews.author: OldHermit

customer_reviews.title: OEM replacement
customer_reviews.text: After about 30k miles the cabin air filter in my Silverado gets pretty gross and full of leaves and other tree droppings. I've been changing them out with these now since I bought the truck new, and have had no complaints. The filters install easily, seem to do a good job of filtering the air coming into the passenger compartment, and when changed, seem to make the truck smell cleaner inside. I will continue to use these every 30k miles or so.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the dealer or service shop do this for you...
customer_reviews.text: The videos I found online for how to install this filter were vast. So many people have done this on different vehicles that there is no excuse to not do this yourself. I saved almost $80 by doing this myself. The part is exactly the same as the OEM filter (part number and all) so it shouldn't give you any issues. So glad I replaced it. My truck smells almost like new again!
customer_reviews.author: Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Nice filter but 1 job turns into 2.
customer_reviews.text: You don’t need a fancy filter. This one works just fine. If you have a 2014 Silverado or newer, be prepared to dig leafs out of your blower motor because it isn’t possible to take out the old filter without spilling leafs into the blower. Luckily taking out the blower motor isn’t too difficult. If your blower sounds like a Harley after you change the filter, that’s what happened. Changing the filter and emptying the blower motor only took about 20 minutes total.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: 2015 Duramax cabin filter!!?
customer_reviews.text: Didn't even know my truck had one starting out; bought this for my 2015 GMC Sierra 2500 Duramax. Just in time too, I changed out my original cabin filter at 20k miles, and it was pretty dirty. It fits & I plan to keep intervals at 20k.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Made in USA
customer_reviews.text: I got this over to "professional" one. It was a couple of dollars more. This one is made in the USA. The other is made in China. This is exactly what was in there. Easy to replace, fit perfectly. I will order these exclusively from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be careful when changing filter!
customer_reviews.text: Good oem replacement filter! Be careful when changing. I had an acorn on the other side of the filter which fell into my fan. Really loud noise when fan would be on. Luckily I had good service at the GM dealer which the dealer took care of it!
customer_reviews.author: Vinnyb24

customer_reviews.title: OEM at a great price!  I'd buy again
customer_reviews.text: GM OEM filter at a great price - watch youtube for install video - not hard, just a bit tedious, but why pay the dealer to pull out 6 screws, a retractable pull for the door, and the filter door - T15 torx screwdriver is all you need and some standing on your head to get the old one out and new one in. Matched GM part exactly.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: If you breathe, ask yourself why you don’t want clean air in the vehicle cabin
customer_reviews.text: My home is on a dusty dirt road, these make the car/ truck so much nicer to drive. Our daughter is asthmatic these are a Must! Install in minutes, looked at YouTube to find location and install info- piece of cake!
customer_reviews.author: Skipper

customer_reviews.title: Tip for installation
customer_reviews.text: Works and fits perfectly. I have a 2016 GMC Sierra. Tip for installation...slide a piece of paper under the old filter before you pull it out. This will prevent anything from falling into the fan housing as you pull the old filter out. I didn’t and spent about 2 hours trying to get a leaf out.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your vehicle air clean
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my truck cab clean. Easy to install in my truck. Not so much in some vehicles. Works great. Seeing all the dirt and debris on the old one when you change it shows how much it filters out.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Fit my 2015 Sierra 1500 reg cab truck
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfect on my 2015 sierra 1500 reg cab truck the original one was filthy and had no air flow imprint on the air filter like the new one. Only wish the new one would state this side ^up^ Instead of airflow > design
customer_reviews.author: EatmeNoww

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2018 Chevrolet Silverado
customer_reviews.text: Easy install, just pop out two screws and remove lower glove box (SIMPLE) and open cover, toss old filter and replace with this nice clean white one. 2018 Silverado LT. Make sure to match the arrow on the filter same as the old one, down I think - youtube the installation there are a lot of how to videos on this.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Original filter but bad packaging
customer_reviews.text: Genuine Delco OEM filter. One star for bad packaging no box, filter arrived folded but was able to re-shape pleats and use. Installation semi-difficult, small tight space, recommend watching YouTube video first.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Acker

customer_reviews.title: Fit but was not well shipped
customer_reviews.text: Product fit my 2018 Silverado 2500 HD perfectly. The filter was NOT in a box, just a plastic “bag”, it was bent out of shape and mashed on one end. NOT impressed with shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fits perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This item was exactly the same as what I had in the truck gmc sierra 2014 and it fit perfectly. good product too.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Bugarin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement
customer_reviews.text: Perfect replacement for my 2014 Chevy Silverado cabin filter. After only 25k miles it was completely filthy. Truck vents smell better now.
customer_reviews.author: B_Krayzie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Original equipment, fit perfectly and only took five minutes to install in my Silverado. Saved $70.00 by doing it myself as opposed to the dealership doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Merkle

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: This filter fit great, great price, and has a arrow pointing in air flow direction so you can't put it upside down. I'll be buying this again when it's time for the next change. The comparison is around 25k miles on the old one, enjoy the fresh air!
customer_reviews.author: Jared J

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install on a 2017 Silverado.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install on a 2017 Silverado. With a T-15 TORX BIT and a drill, 4 screws and two filter door release tabs, an average person can have it installed in under 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why car manufacturers don't tell you about these little filters, but they are not that hard to change. Less than four years on my Tahoe and I can tell you, the old filter was nasty dirty. The OEM replacement filter fit right in. Will be changing this more often now.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Celeritas

customer_reviews.title: Installed on a 2015 Yukon XL
customer_reviews.text: This Cabin filter fit my 2015 Yukon XL perfectly. Had to drop down the glove box, remove six screws, unsnap a protective cover and remove the filter. I had 20k miles on the filter and it was pretty dirty. Will replace annually from now on.
customer_reviews.author: J. Manning

customer_reviews.title: OEM cabin filter for my GM vehicle, Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: OEM cabin filter for my GM vehicle. Good price, easy to install and improved my air flow through my heater/AC, not to mention cleaning the air too. The old filter was dirty, dirty, dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Rich B.

customer_reviews.title: Simple
customer_reviews.text: Product does what it’s supposed to do. I saved a lot of money installing it myself as opposed to having dealer install it. Extremely simple!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OEM
customer_reviews.text: Can verify OEM Delco filter. Fits right back in place. Be sure to point the arrow down with air flow direction.
customer_reviews.author: airtight_python

customer_reviews.title: Do it sooner than later, filter was pretty plugged.
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t sure the 2500 HD had a cabin filter but sure enough. This thing fit perfectly. LONG OVER DUE at 62000 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Do it yourself and save
customer_reviews.text: The dealer said I needed a new cabin air filter. So I bought one at half the price and installed it myself. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Fosselman

customer_reviews.title: What a BARGAIN
customer_reviews.text: Great OEM filter. The last one I had the dealer replace for me and they charged me $50.00. It took about 5 minutes to do it myself.
customer_reviews.author: Al Grant

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly in my 2016 GMC Sierra...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, fits great. It does just what it's supposed to do so I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Hamm

customer_reviews.title: It's a filter.. Not much else to say
customer_reviews.text: Much needed replacement for my truck. Just keep in mind that if anything falls down in the fan when you change the filter you will get a loud buzzing noise from the fan motor. Lots of guys use a clip board to stop this.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Acdelco is great
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I would definitely recommend any ACDelco products. Good prices compared to others that are much more expensive for the same exact thing.
customer_reviews.author: M. D. Bartick

customer_reviews.title: Fits my 2014 Silverado 1500 LTZ
customer_reviews.text: I change the cabin filter every year after pollen season (Live in North Carolina :-)
customer_reviews.author: S_Henley

customer_reviews.title: Save some money and do it yourself
customer_reviews.text: YouTube the video on how to install just follow the directions and you can save yourself a ton of money
customer_reviews.author: ts

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Fit Vehicle
customer_reviews.text: There is a feature which supposedly matches your car with the proper filters. I purchased a filter that was labeled to fit my car and was surprised to find that it doesn't fit at all.
customer_reviews.author: Diva Girl

customer_reviews.title: nice fit to my 2014 chevy silverado
customer_reviews.text: As expected, nice fit to my 2014 chevy silverado. Considering replacing this filter once a year as they get really dirty really fast.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando h.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Good filter - no manufacturing smell and the fit was perfect. Just what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: IIIBradIII

customer_reviews.title: Good filter
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, looked exactly like the one I took out but the cost was cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It's an air filter and it fits my 2014 Silverado. So I'm good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Old filter was disgusting, bugs leaves
customer_reviews.text: Fit my 2014 Silverado 5.3 Crew cab perfectly. Old filter was disgusting, bugs leaves, almost a black color to it and that was only after 25,000 miles. Plan to keep replacing this every 15-20k
customer_reviews.author: Matt D

customer_reviews.title: Quality built.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and cleans up the smell from the A/C.

customer_reviews.title: Save money, do the job yourself
customer_reviews.text: Don’t need a professional to replace. Just need a T-15 torx screwdriver.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Original equipment do of course perfect. A little tricky to install- 15 minutes

customer_reviews.title: easy tio change out watch video on you tube
customer_reviews.text: perfect fit for my chevy 2500 diesel. my truck was only 3 years old. thought why not change it.? it was horribly dirty I will be changing every year or maybe 6 months.

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor & change the cabin filter!!
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was Super fast and this was the same exact filter that my truck came with for a lot less than if I purchased it elsewhere. Plus, I can’t believe how bad the original one was after a year . . . It was jet black compared to the snow while replacement.

customer_reviews.title: Great filter for my GMC Sierra
customer_reviews.text: Does the job and OEM quality. Worth every dollar, simple to install with one tool.

customer_reviews.text: It was identical to the factory filter that I was replacing.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: A really good price on the genuine article. I've seen dealers try to charge $50 for this same unit.

customer_reviews.title: Go for it!
customer_reviews.text: There is No ease of install lol! Vehicle manufacturers design these placements so most people have to take them in to have them serviced! Just a couple of tools and YouTube made it a breeze

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: Car dealer shop charges $45.00 + installation. It's a bargain do it your self.

customer_reviews.title: Better quality than after-market filters.
customer_reviews.text: This filter went in my 2014 Silverado. It is much better than the one that I purchased at an auto store. And cheaper.

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2018 Silverado
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly, easy to install. Did this at 30k miles, and the old one was trash.

customer_reviews.title: Shipped fast and couldn't be happier. Will order again

product_meta.title: ACDelco CF188 GM Original Equipment Cabin Air Filter
product_meta.description: An ACDelco GM Original Equipment Cabin Air Filter is a GM-recommended replacement for your vehicle’s original component. It keeps pollens, fumes, smoke, and other materials from reaching the inside of the vehicle. High quality filtration media removes most airborne allergens and particles before they reach the vehicle's ventilation system. The cabin air filter keeps bacteria and mold from growing inside of your vehicle’s ventilation system, helping to reduce vehicle odor. This original equipment cabin air filter has been manufactured to fit your GM vehicle, providing the same performance, durability, and service life you expect from General Motors.
feature_bullets: Equipped with long media in the non-woven material/compound media in order to capture more particles while increasing air flow

Has compound media that consists of three layers in which the outside layer captures 100% of large airborne particles, the middle layer captures smaller particles, and the final layer provides strength and stability
Has a layered construction that creates ‘separated’ media in order to better contain dust and pollen particles, resulting in higher efficiency
GM-recommended replacement part for your GM vehicle’s original factory component
Offering the quality, reliability, and durability of GM OE
Equipped with long media in the non-woven material/compound media in order to capture more particles while increasing air flow

Has compound media that consists of three layers in which the outside layer captures 100% of large airborne particles, the middle layer captures smaller particles, and the final layer provides strength and stability
Has a layered construction that creates ‘separated’ media in order to better contain dust and pollen particles, resulting in higher efficiency
GM-recommended replacement part for your GM vehicle’s original factory component
Offering the quality, reliability, and durability of GM OE
Manufactured to GM OE specification for fit, form, and function
